posts.title: How to Use ASCII Art in Discord (2026 Guide)
posts.excerpt: Learn how to use ASCII art in Discord messages, profiles, and status. Complete guide with best practices and popular examples.
posts.content:
What is ASCII Art in Discord?

ASCII art is a creative way to express yourself in Discord using text characters. Whether you want to add personality to your messages, create eye-catching server announcements, or make your profile stand out, ASCII art offers endless possibilities.

How to Use ASCII Art in Discord

1. In Messages

Simply copy any ASCII art from our gallery and paste it into your Discord chat. For best results:

  • Use code blocks (```text) to preserve formatting
  • Test in a private channel first
  • Keep it appropriate for the server

2. In Your Profile Bio

Add small, simple ASCII art to your Discord profile:

  • Go to User Settings â†’ Edit Profile
  • Paste your chosen ASCII art in the About Me section
  • Use single-line designs for best display

3. In Server Announcements

Make announcements stand out with decorative borders and symbols:

  • Use border ASCII art to frame important messages
  • Add celebratory ASCII art for events
  • Create custom dividers between sections

Popular ASCII Art for Discord

Shrug Emoticon

The classic shrug Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯ is perfect for expressing indifference or playful confusion.

Table Flip

Express frustration with (â•¯Â°â–¡Â°)â•¯ï¸µ â”»â”â”» - a Discord community favorite.

Cute Animals

Share adorable ASCII cats, dogs, and bunnies to add warmth to conversations.

Sparkles and Stars

Decorate messages with âœ¨, â­, and other symbol art.

Best Practices

  • Test Before Posting: ASCII art can display differently on mobile vs desktop
  • Use Code Blocks: Wrap in ```text blocks to preserve spacing
  • Keep It Simple: Smaller designs work better in chat
  • Check Server Rules: Some servers have restrictions on ASCII art
  • Don't Spam: Use ASCII art sparingly to maintain impact

Top Discord ASCII Art Categories

  • Emoticons & Kaomoji: Express emotions quickly
  • Animals: Cats, dogs, bears for cute reactions
  • Symbols: Hearts, arrows, and decorative elements
  • Borders: Frame important announcements
  • Memes: Popular internet culture references

Troubleshooting

ASCII Art Looks Broken

If your ASCII art doesn't display correctly:

  • Make sure you're using code blocks (```)
  • Use a monospace-friendly font
  • Check that all characters copied properly

Too Wide for Mobile

Choose simpler, narrower designs that fit mobile screens. Single-line emoticons work best.

Conclusion

ASCII art is a fun, creative way to enhance your Discord experience. Browse our collection to find the perfect art for your messages, profile, or server announcements. Remember to use it thoughtfully and have fun expressing yourself!

posts.title: Top 50 Copy-Paste ASCII Art for Developers
posts.excerpt: Essential ASCII art collection for developers. Use in code comments, README files, commit messages, and documentation.
posts.content:
Why Developers Love ASCII Art

ASCII art has been part of developer culture since the earliest days of computing. From decorating code comments to creating memorable README files, text art adds personality and clarity to technical projects.

Best ASCII Art for Code Comments

Section Dividers

Organize your code with clear visual separators:

  • Create distinct sections in long files
  • Mark important function groups
  • Separate configuration blocks

TODO and Warning Markers

Make important comments stand out with ASCII art borders and symbols. Draw attention to critical sections that need review or future work.

Function Headers

Document functions with styled ASCII art headers that improve code readability and navigation.

README File Enhancements

Project Banners

Create eye-catching headers for your README files that make your project memorable on GitHub.

Feature Lists

Use ASCII bullets and symbols to organize feature descriptions and make documentation more scannable.

Installation Guides

Add ASCII arrows and boxes to guide users through installation steps clearly.

Git Commit Art

Celebratory Commits

Mark major milestones with fun ASCII art in commit messages:

  • Project launches
  • Version releases
  • Bug fixes after long debugging sessions

Breaking Changes

Use warning symbols to highlight commits with breaking changes that need attention.

Terminal Output

Success Messages

Celebrate successful builds and tests with checkmarks and success symbols.

Error Indicators

Make errors impossible to miss with ASCII art warning signs.

Progress Indicators

Create custom ASCII spinners and progress bars for CLI tools.

Documentation

Table of Contents

Use ASCII art to create visual table of contents structures in markdown documentation.

Code Flow Diagrams

Illustrate program flow with simple ASCII diagrams using arrows and boxes.

API Endpoint Lists

Organize API documentation with ASCII art borders and dividers.

Developer Emoticons

Code Review Reactions

Popular emoticons for code review comments:

  • Thumbs up for good code
  • Shrug for edge cases
  • Table flip for frustrating bugs
  • Dancing figures for successful merges

Slack/Discord Developer Channels

Quick ASCII reactions for team communication:

  • Bug found: ğŸ› plus ASCII exclamation
  • Deployment success: ASCII celebration
  • Need help: ASCII question marks

Programming Language Specific

JavaScript/TypeScript

ASCII art that works great in JS comments without breaking syntax:

  • Single-line // comment art
  • Multi-line /* block */ decorations
  • JSDoc compatible headers

Python

Docstring-friendly ASCII art for Python modules and functions.

Java/C++

Traditional block comment ASCII art for class and method documentation.

Best Practices for Developers

  • Keep It Professional: Use ASCII art tastefully in production code
  • Consider Code Reviews: Not all teams appreciate decorative comments
  • Use for Clarity: ASCII art should improve understanding, not distract
  • Monospace Fonts: Always test in your code editor's font
  • Version Control Friendly: Simple designs work better in diffs

Tools and Resources

ASCII Art Generators

While our copy-paste collection is ready to use, you can also generate custom ASCII art for specific project names or logos.

Editor Extensions

Some IDEs have extensions that help format and insert ASCII art into comments.

Command Line Tools

CLI tools like figlet can generate ASCII text banners for scripts and automation.

Popular Developer ASCII Art

  • Check Marks: âœ“ âœ” âœ… for success indicators
  • Arrows: â†’ â‡’ âœ for flow and relationships
  • Boxes: â–¡ â–ª â–  for bullet points and lists
  • Dividers: â•â•â• â”€â”€â”€ â”â”â” for section separation
  • Corners: â•”â•â•— â•šâ•â• for framing content

Conclusion

ASCII art is more than just decoration - it's a practical tool for improving code organization and documentation. Browse our developer-focused collection to find the perfect art for your projects. Remember: the best ASCII art enhances readability without cluttering your codebase.

posts.title: Kaomoji vs Emoji: Complete Guide
posts.excerpt: Understand the difference between kaomoji and emoji. Learn when to use each type and explore the most popular examples.
posts.content:
What Are Kaomoji?

Kaomoji (é¡”æ–‡å­—) are Japanese emoticons made using text characters. The word literally means "face characters" in Japanese. Unlike Western emoticons that are read sideways :), kaomoji are read straight-on and often include a much wider range of emotions and expressions.

What Are Emoji?

Emoji are colorful pictographic images that originated in Japan but have become universal digital symbols. They're built into operating systems and display as actual images rather than text characters.

Key Differences

Format

  • Kaomoji: Text-based characters like (â—•â€¿â—•) or (â•¯Â°â–¡Â°)â•¯ï¸µ â”»â”â”»
  • Emoji: Image-based symbols like ğŸ˜Š or ğŸ‰

Platform Compatibility

  • Kaomoji: Display consistently across all platforms and devices
  • Emoji: Can look different on iOS, Android, Windows, etc.

Customization

  • Kaomoji: Highly customizable - create your own combinations
  • Emoji: Fixed set determined by Unicode Consortium

Expression Range

  • Kaomoji: Nuanced emotions, actions, and situations
  • Emoji: Standardized emotions and objects

When to Use Kaomoji

For Unique Expression

Kaomoji excel at conveying specific moods that don't have an emoji equivalent. You can express complex emotions like determined enthusiasm (à¸‡'Ì€-'Ì)à¸‡ or playful mischief ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°).

For Consistent Display

When you need your message to look the same across all platforms, kaomoji are the reliable choice. No more wondering if your Android emoji looks different on iOS.

For Text-Only Environments

Some platforms or contexts don't support emoji well. Kaomoji work everywhere text works - code comments, plain text files, terminal output, etc.

For Internet Culture

Classic kaomoji like the table flip (â•¯Â°â–¡Â°)â•¯ï¸µ â”»â”â”» or shrug Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯ are iconic internet culture references that convey more than just emotion.

When to Use Emoji

For Quick Communication

Emoji are faster to type (just search in your keyboard) and immediately recognizable. They're perfect for quick reactions and casual messaging.

For Visual Impact

The colorful nature of emoji makes them stand out in messages. They're great for adding visual interest and breaking up text.

For Universal Recognition

Common emoji like ğŸ‘, â¤ï¸, and ğŸ˜‚ are instantly understood worldwide, making them ideal for international communication.

For Mobile Messaging

Emoji are built into mobile keyboards and are designed for quick mobile communication. They're the standard for modern chat apps.

Popular Kaomoji Categories

Happy Kaomoji

  • (â—•â€¿â—•) - Cute smile
  • (ï½¡â—•â€¿â—•ï½¡) - Sweet and innocent
  • ï¼¼(ï¼¾â–½ï¼¾)ï¼ - Excited and happy
  • (â— â€¿â— ) - Gentle smile

Action Kaomoji

  • (â•¯Â°â–¡Â°)â•¯ï¸µ â”»â”â”» - Table flip
  • â”¬â”€â”¬ãƒ( Âº _ Âºãƒ) - Putting table back
  • ãƒ½(â€¢â€¿â€¢)ãƒ - Celebration
  • (à¸‡'Ì€-'Ì)à¸‡ - Ready to fight

Animal Kaomoji

  • (=^ï½¥Ï‰ï½¥^=) - Cat
  • Ê•â€¢á´¥â€¢Ê” - Bear
  • (ï½¥Ï‰ï½¥) - Small animal face
  • âˆªï¼¾Ï‰ï¼¾âˆª - Dog

Mood Kaomoji

  • (Â¬â€¿Â¬) - Suspicious
  • (â•¥_â•¥) - Crying
  • ï¼ˆï¿£ãƒ¼ï¿£ï¼‰ - Confident
  • (âŠ™_âŠ™) - Surprised

Combining Both

You don't have to choose! Many people use both kaomoji and emoji together:

  • Use emoji for quick reactions, kaomoji for nuanced expression
  • Combine them: "Great job! ğŸ‰ ï¼¼(ï¼¾â–½ï¼¾)ï¼"
  • Match the style to your audience and platform

Cultural Context

Japanese Origin

Both kaomoji and emoji have Japanese roots, but they evolved differently. Kaomoji developed from ASCII art culture, while emoji were created for mobile phones.

Global Adoption

Emoji have become globally standardized through Unicode. Kaomoji remain more niche but are beloved in online communities, especially gaming, anime, and tech circles.

Accessibility Considerations

Screen Readers

  • Kaomoji: May be read as individual characters
  • Emoji: Usually have descriptive labels

Visual Clarity

  • Kaomoji: Can be hard to read at small sizes
  • Emoji: Scale better but may lose detail

Conclusion

Kaomoji and emoji each have their strengths. Emoji are perfect for quick, colorful communication on modern platforms. Kaomoji excel at nuanced expression and work consistently everywhere. Choose based on your needs - or use both! Explore our collection to find the perfect kaomoji for any situation.

posts.title: ASCII Art for Social Media Bios
posts.excerpt: Make your Instagram, Twitter, and TikTok bios stand out with creative ASCII art. Best symbols, borders, and designs for social profiles.
posts.content:
Why Use ASCII Art in Social Media Bios?

Your social media bio is prime real estate - often the first thing people see when they visit your profile. ASCII art helps you stand out from the crowd, express personality, and make your bio more visually interesting within strict character limits.

Best ASCII Art for Instagram Bios

Aesthetic Symbols

Instagram is all about aesthetics. Use these symbols to match your feed's vibe:

  • Stars and sparkles: âœ¨ â­ â˜… â˜†
  • Arrows: â†’ â‡¢ âœ âŸ¹
  • Dots and dividers: â€¢ Â· â‹† Ëšï½¡â‹†
  • Hearts: â™¡ â¤ ğŸ’•

Bio Dividers

Separate different sections of your bio with elegant dividers:

  • Simple lines: â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
  • Decorative borders: Â·:*Â¨Â¨*:Â·.
  • Dot patterns: â€¢â€¢â€¢ â‹†ï½¡Ëš â‹†ï½¡Ëš

Minimalist Frames

Frame important info like your location or profession:

  • Simple brackets: ã€” text ã€•
  • Fancy borders: â•”â•â•â•â•— text â•šâ•â•â•â•
  • Corners: â”Œâ”€ text â”€â”

Twitter/X Bio ASCII Art

Professional Symbols

For professional Twitter accounts:

  • Bullet points: â–ª â–« â–  â–¡
  • Check marks: âœ“ âœ”
  • Job role indicators: ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’¼ plus ASCII arrows

Creative Expression

Show personality with creative emoticons:

  • Kaomoji reactions: (â—•â€¿â—•) (^_^)
  • Activity symbols: ğŸ® + controller ASCII art
  • Interest markers: ğŸ“š + book borders

Contact Info Framing

Make your contact info stand out:

  • Email: âœ‰ email@example.com
  • Website: ğŸŒ â†’ yoursite.com
  • Location: ğŸ“ City, Country

TikTok Bio Styling

Trendy Symbols

TikTok audiences love creative, eye-catching bios:

  • Sparkles and stars: âœ¨â­
  • Music notes: â™ª â™« â™¬
  • Dancing figures: â™ªâ”(ãƒ»oï½¥)â”›â™ªâ”— ( ï½¥oï½¥) â”“â™ª

Creator Categories

Identify your content niche:

  • Gaming: ğŸ® + game controller ASCII
  • Food: ğŸ• + fork and knife symbols
  • Fashion: ğŸ‘— + clothing rack ASCII

LinkedIn Professional Bios

Subtle Enhancement

LinkedIn calls for professional restraint, but subtle ASCII art can still help:

  • Section dividers: â€¢ | â€¢
  • Bullet points: â–ª â–«
  • Arrows for progression: â†’ â‡¢

Achievement Markers

Highlight credentials subtly:

  • Certifications: âœ“ Certified in X
  • Languages: â€¢ English â€¢ Spanish â€¢ French
  • Skills: â–ª Skill 1 â–ª Skill 2 â–ª Skill 3

Platform-Specific Tips

Instagram

  • Character Limit: 150 characters - be concise
  • Line Breaks: Use notes app to format, then copy
  • Aesthetic: Match your feed's visual style
  • Clickable Links: Only one link allowed, make it count

Twitter/X

  • Character Limit: 160 characters
  • Searchable: Include relevant keywords
  • Professional: Many use Twitter for networking
  • Personality: More casual than LinkedIn

TikTok

  • Character Limit: 80 characters
  • Gen Z Audience: Be authentic and fun
  • Content Hints: Tell viewers what to expect
  • Call to Action: Encourage follows or engagement

Bio Structure Templates

Creator Bio

âœ¨ [Your Niche] Creator
ğŸ“ [Location]
âœ‰ [Contact]
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
[Short tagline or mission]

Professional Bio

[Job Title] @ [Company]
â–ª [Skill 1] â–ª [Skill 2] â–ª [Skill 3]
â†’ [What you do/offer]
ğŸŒ [Website]

Personal Brand Bio

ğŸ¯ [Your Focus]
ğŸ’¡ [What you share/teach]
ğŸ“š [Credentials or experience]
â‹†ï½¡Ëš [Fun fact or personality trait]
ğŸ‘‡ [Link description]

Common Mistakes to Avoid

Too Much ASCII Art

Don't overdo it. A few well-placed symbols are better than a cluttered mess of characters.

Hard to Read

Ensure your bio remains readable. Fancy ASCII art shouldn't make your actual content unclear.

Outdated Information

Update your ASCII-enhanced bio regularly to keep information current.

Platform Inappropriate

Match the formality to the platform - what works on TikTok might not work on LinkedIn.

Testing Your Bio

Multiple Devices

View your bio on both mobile and desktop to ensure ASCII art displays correctly.

Different Browsers

Some ASCII characters may render differently across browsers.

Screenshot Check

Take a screenshot to see how your bio appears to visitors.

Trending Bio Styles (2026)

Minimalist Aesthetic

Clean, simple symbols with lots of white space. Less is more.

Y2K Revival

Stars, sparkles, and early internet aesthetic making a comeback.

Dark Academia

Subtle, sophisticated symbols like old book dividers and classical frames.

Cottagecore

Nature-inspired symbols: flowers, leaves, sun, and moon ASCII art.

Conclusion

ASCII art can transform a plain social media bio into something memorable and unique. Start simple with a few strategic symbols, test on multiple devices, and adjust based on your audience's response. Browse our collection for the perfect bio enhancements, and don't be afraid to experiment until you find your style!

posts.title: Text Art Borders and Dividers Collection
posts.excerpt: Complete collection of copy-paste text borders and dividers. Perfect for decorating messages, documents, and social media posts.
posts.content:
What Are Text Art Borders and Dividers?

Text art borders and dividers are decorative ASCII patterns used to separate content, frame text, or add visual structure to plain text documents. They're essential tools for anyone who wants to make their text content more visually appealing without using images or graphics.

Types of Text Borders

Simple Line Borders

The most basic and versatile type, using simple characters:

  • Dashes: â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
  • Equals: â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  • Hyphens: ---------
  • Underscores: _________

Box Borders

Complete frames for surrounding text:

  • Single line: â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ text â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
  • Double line: â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•— â•‘ text â•‘ â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•
  • Mixed styles: â•­â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â•® â”‚ text â”‚ â•°â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â•¯

Decorative Borders

Fancy designs for special occasions:

  • Stars: â˜…â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â˜…
  • Flowers: âœ¿â•â•â•â•â•â•â•âœ¿
  • Hearts: â™¥â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â™¥
  • Snowflakes: â„â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â„

Wave and Curve Borders

Organic, flowing designs:

  • Waves: ï½ï½ï½ï½ï½
  • Curves: ï½ã€œã€œï½ã€œï½
  • Tildes: ~~~~~~~~~~~

Types of Text Dividers

Horizontal Dividers

Separate sections of text:

  • Dots: â€¢ â€¢ â€¢ â€¢ â€¢ â€¢
  • Arrows: â¤â¤â¤â¤â¤â¤â¤
  • Diamonds: â—†â—†â—†â—†â—†â—†â—†
  • Circles: â—‹â—‹â—‹â—‹â—‹â—‹â—‹

Centered Dividers

Symmetric designs with focal points:

  • Star center: â”€â”€â˜…â”€â”€
  • Diamond center: â”€â—†â”€
  • Flower center: â”€âœ¿â”€
  • Heart center: â”€â™¥â”€

Thick Dividers

Bold separation for major sections:

  • Heavy dashes: â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
  • Double lines: â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  • Filled blocks: â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

Use Cases

Messages and Chat

Make your messages stand out:

  • Frame important announcements
  • Separate different topics in long messages
  • Create visual hierarchy in group chats
  • Add flair to birthday wishes and greetings

Documents

Enhance plain text documents:

  • README files on GitHub
  • Email newsletters
  • Plain text reports
  • Terminal output formatting

Social Media

Break up long posts:

  • Instagram captions with multiple thoughts
  • Twitter threads
  • Facebook announcements
  • LinkedIn articles

Code Comments

Organize code sections:

  • Separate function groups
  • Mark configuration sections
  • Create visual hierarchy in long files
  • Highlight important TODOs

Popular Border Styles

Minimalist Modern

Clean, simple lines perfect for professional contexts:

  • Thin single lines
  • Subtle dot patterns
  • Simple corners

Retro Terminal

Classic computing aesthetic:

  • Double-line boxes
  • ASCII line drawing characters
  • Monospace-friendly designs

Decorative Fancy

Ornate designs for special occasions:

  • Floral patterns
  • Snowflakes and stars
  • Hearts and celebration symbols

Geometric Modern

Angular, contemporary designs:

  • Triangle patterns
  • Diamond chains
  • Arrow sequences

Creating Custom Borders

Repeating Patterns

Create your own by repeating characters:

  • Choose a symbol: â˜…
  • Add connecting elements: â•
  • Combine: â˜…â•â˜…â•â˜…â•â˜…

Symmetric Designs

Build from the center out:

  • Pick center element: â—†
  • Mirror on both sides: â”€â—†â”€
  • Extend: â•â•â•â—†â•â•â•

Mixed Characters

Combine different symbols:

  • Dots and lines: â€¢â”€â€¢â”€â€¢
  • Stars and dashes: â˜…â”€â˜…â”€â˜…
  • Mixed borders: â•”â•â˜…â•â•—

Platform Compatibility

Universal Characters

These work everywhere:

  • Hyphens: ---
  • Equals: ===
  • Asterisks: ***
  • Basic symbols: ., â€¢, -, =

Unicode Characters

Work on most modern platforms:

  • Box drawing: â”€ â”‚ â”Œ â” â”” â”˜
  • Block elements: â–ª â–« â–  â–¡
  • Geometric shapes: â—† â—‡ â—‹ â—

Special Characters

May not display on all platforms:

  • Ornate symbols: âœ¿ â€ â
  • Rare Unicode: â‹† âŠ± âŠ°
  • Emoji combinations: âœ¨â”€âœ¨

Best Practices

Match Your Context

Choose border style based on use:

  • Professional: Simple lines, subtle patterns
  • Casual: Fun symbols, decorative elements
  • Technical: Box drawing characters, ASCII art
  • Celebratory: Stars, hearts, festive designs

Consider Length

Adjust border length to your content:

  • Short messages: 20-30 characters
  • Standard: 40-50 characters
  • Full width: 60-80 characters
  • Mobile-friendly: Keep under 40

Test Display

Always check how borders appear:

  • View on mobile and desktop
  • Test in target application
  • Check with different font sizes
  • Verify alignment in monospace fonts

Seasonal and Themed Borders

Holiday Themes

  • Christmas: â„â•â•â•â˜…â•â•â•â„
  • Valentine's: â™¥â•â•â•â™¥â•â•â•â™¥
  • Halloween: ğŸƒâ•â•â•ğŸ‘»â•â•â•ğŸƒ
  • Spring: âœ¿â•â•â•ğŸŒ¸â•â•â•âœ¿

Event Borders

  • Birthday: ğŸ‚â•â•â•ğŸ‰â•â•â•ğŸ‚
  • Celebration: âœ¨â•â•â•ğŸŠâ•â•â•âœ¨
  • Achievement: ğŸ†â•â•â•â­â•â•â•ğŸ†

Combining Borders and Dividers

Document Structure

Use borders for major sections and dividers for subsections:

  • Main sections: Full box borders
  • Subsections: Horizontal dividers
  • Lists: Simple bullets or arrows

Visual Hierarchy

Create depth with different styles:

  • Level 1: Heavy double lines
  • Level 2: Single lines
  • Level 3: Dotted dividers

Conclusion

Text borders and dividers are simple but powerful tools for improving text formatting. Whether you're decorating a message, organizing a document, or adding flair to your social media, the right border can make all the difference. Browse our collection to find the perfect style for any occasion, and don't hesitate to mix and match to create your own unique designs!
